name: Cover Crop Type
description: Common name for categories of cover crops.

name: Environmental Tolerances
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Drought
values.description:
Ability to tolerate drought relative to other species.

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

values.name: Flood
values.description:
Ability to tolerate flood relative to other species.

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

values.name: Heat
values.description:
Ability to tolerate heat relative to other species.

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

values.name: Low Fertility
values.description:
Ability to tolerate poor fertility in general (an amalgamation of low pH soils and/or below-optimum soil tests for N, P, and/or K, sandy soil).

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

values.name: Salinity
values.description:
Ability to tolerate high salinity relative to other species.

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

values.name: Shade
values.description:
Ability to tolerate shade relative to other species.

1 = intolerant, 5 = high tolerance

name: Growth
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Active Growth Period
values.description: Season in which plants have active growth.

values.name: Duration
values.description: Length of time during which the cover crop's entire lifecycle is completed in the selected zone. Cover crops that have different Durations depending on environment or location are reported in order of increasing longevity in nature.

values.name: Early Spring Growth
values.description:
Speed in the spring at which the cover crop breaks dormancy and grows.

1= slow, 5 = fast. No star means that early spring growth is not applicable.

values.name: Ease of Establishment
values.description:
Degree of difficulty in getting cover crop established.

1 = difficult to establish 5 = very easy to establish

values.name: Establishes Quickly
values.description:
Speed at which the cover crop establishes once planted.

1 = slow to establish 5 = quick to establish

values.name: Growing Window
values.description: Relative length of time that is suitable for growing and terminating a cover crop. For example, cover crops with a very short growing window may be planted and terminated during a very short period (e.g., 6-8 weeks) between cash crops.

values.name: Supports Mycorrhizae
values.description:
Cover crop ability to promote relative activity of mycorrhizal fungi in the rhizosphere.

1 = low support, 5 = high support

values.name: Winter Survival
values.description: Likelihood of cover crop survival over the winter.

name: Roots
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Root Architecture
values.description: Primary root structure: tap or fibrous.

values.name: Root Depth
values.description: Depth to which the cover crop roots. Considers the relative ability of the roots to grow deeper than the previous crop (to reach residual nitrogen).

values.name: Aerial Seeding
values.description: Aerial seeding methods can be used for this crop.

values.name: Frost Seeding
values.description: Cover crop can be broadcast seeded when ground is frozen.

name: Seeds
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Seed Price per Pound
values.description:
Relative cost of seed per pound.

1 = least expensive, 3 = most expensive.

name: Termination Methods
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Chemical at Flowering
values.description:
Likelihood that herbicide application will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage.

1 = unlikely to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate

values.name: Chemical at Vegetative
values.description:
Likelihood that herbicide application will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage.

1 = unlikely to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate

values.name: Freezing at Flowering
values.description:
Likelihood that conditions below 32 degrees F will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage.

1 = requires a very significant freeze to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate in mild freeze

values.name: Freezing at Vegetative
values.description:
Likelihood that freezing weather conditions will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage.

1 = requires a very significant freeze to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate in mild freeze

values.name: Mow at Flowering
values.description:
Likelihood that mowing (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that do not disturb the soil) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage.

1 = unlikely to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate

values.name: Roller Crimp at Flowering
values.description:
Likelihood that roller-crimping will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage. Termination is most successful at higher crop densities (3+ tons of dry matter per acre). Roller crimping is usually used in tandem with chemical termination outside of organic systems.

1 = unlikely to terminate, 5 = likely to terminate

values.name: Tillage at Flowering
values.description:
Liklihood that tillage (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that disturb the soil, as with disking or rotovating) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage.

1 = hard to terminate with tillage and requires an aggressive technique, 5 = easy to terminate with tillage and requires the least aggressive technique. The techniques are categorized as follows. 1-moldboard 2-rototill 3-chisel plow 4-heavy disk 5-light disk

values.name: Tillage at Vegetative
values.description:
Likelihood that tillage (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that disturb the soil, as with disking or rotovating) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage.

1 = hard to terminate with tillage and requires an aggressive technique, 5 = easy to terminate with tillage and requires the least aggressive technique. The techniques are categorized as follows. 1-moldboard 2-rototill 3-chisel plow 4-heavy disk 5-light disk

name: Weeds
description: This data is based on expert opinion.

values.name: Persistence
values.description:
Indicates likelihood that the cover crop seed, once planted, will sit in the soil for an extended time then germinate at an inopportune moment (e.g., during cash crop growth). This is a long-term issue in which the "risk is in the cover crop seed bag".

1 = rarely has hard seed, 5 = hard seed is a frequent concern.

values.name: Volunteer Establishment
values.description:
Risk of previous cover crop volunteering in current cash crop due to management (i.e. the previous cover crop setting seed that becomes part of the soil weed seedbank). Impact depends on crop rotation (i.e. desirability of self-reseeding).

1= rarely volunteers, 5 = frequently volunteers
